item.title: Nier weapon data in XML (and LINQ sample query)
item.description: Information about a new XML data file with Nier weapon upgrade information.

item.title: Interesting feature with parsing XML with jQuery on Safari
item.description: Interesting results on parsing XML with jQuery on current versions of various browsers.

item.title: Storing watched movies and Netflix shipping/receiving in XML format
item.description: Thoughts on tracking movies and Netflix shipping/receiving information.

item.title: Extended iTunes Track class for PHP
item.description: Having created a base class in PHP for an iTunes track, here's an extended class, with sample code.

item.title: The benefits of using a file for Log Parser SQL queries
item.description: With Log Parser, you can define your SQL query in a file, instead of on the command line.

item.title: Shadow Hearts: Covenant leveling information
item.description: Leveling information for Shadow Hearts: Covenant.

item.title: Importing a custom namespace / custom type into an XSD
item.description: How to save and import a custom type into an XML Schema Document (XSD).

item.title: Onimusha: Dawn of Dreams data
item.description: Data available for the Playstation 2 game Onimusha: Dawn of Dreams.

item.title: XML standards - personal suggestions
item.description: Personal standards I'll be applying to all future XML creation.

item.title: ASP.NET charts example: Odin Sphere: Part 3 - Creating the chart
item.description: In this final part of the series, we use data from an XML file to create a chart of leveling information for Odin Sphere characters.

item.title: ASP.NET charts example: Odin Sphere: Part 2 - Parsing the XML
item.description: In part two of a series on creating charts with ASP.NET, we grab an XML data file and populate our custom objects from part one with the necessary data.

item.title: ASP.NET charts example: Odin Sphere: Part 1 - Introduction and model
item.description: In this series we use data from Odin Sphere to create charts with ASP.NET. After a short introduction, part one creates the object model we'll populate from the data.

item.title: Vehicle gas DTD .NET objects and XML parsing with LINQ
item.description: Having created an XML document, with DTD, to store vehicle fillups, here's a look at a rough object and how to parse them out of XML via LINQ.

item.title: iTunes Playlists to Xml - version 1.6 released
item.description: Version 1.6 of iTunes Playlists to Xml has been released.
